result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J Berthelsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County Ordinance. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew J Berthelsen

defendant.name: Berthelsen, Andrew J
defendant.address: 2250 S Springdale Rd, New Berlin, WI 53146

records.addlTxt:
1:40 PM   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.  Defendant Andrew J Berthelsen in court. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Defendant provided paperwork of completion of counseling. 
Prosecuting attorney moves to amend to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Court finds the defendant guilty.
Court orders the following:
$267.50 along with D/V Surcharge of $100.00 to be paid within 60 days or civil judgment entered subject to collections, as penalty for non payment of fine.

Defendant Andrew J Berthelsen in court.  Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

State's offer calls for completion of up front anger management. Upon completion, charge will be amended to forfeiture.

Defendant states that he has contacted different agencies, but was unsure what type of anger management needed. 

State confirms that Defendant may do general anger management or domestic abuse anger management. 

Court will set a hearing in 30-60 days out for Defendant to start/complete anger management. Court advises the Defendant of his right to an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

09:34 AM Defendant Andrew J Berthelsen in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
